dismissalText.commentary: Nikita Miller run out (Smith) 0 (1b 0x4 0x6 1m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: Pollard, the runner is run out Game over. SA have won. Sammy is crestfallen. Smith fires in the direct hit. It was a length delivery on the middle stump line, pushed out to covers.. and they run for the single that would bring Sammy on strike. It was always going to be tight. Smith picks it at short cover, and flicks it back hand and it's direct hit at the non-striker's end with Pollard just short of the crease. Pollard threw in a desperate dive but it was not to be.

dismissalText.commentary: Nikita Miller run out (Smith) 0 (1b 0x4 0x6 1m) SR: 0

commentTextItems.html: Pollard, the runner is run out Game over. SA have won. Sammy is crestfallen. Smith fires in the direct hit. It was a length delivery on the middle stump line, pushed out to covers.. and they run for the single that would bring Sammy on strike. It was always going to be tight. Smith picks it at short cover, and flicks it back hand and it's direct hit at the non-striker's end with Pollard just short of the crease. Pollard threw in a desperate dive but it was not to be.

commentPostTextItems.html: Spare a thought for Darren Sammy. The crowd look stunned. Sorrowful glares. Smith had flicked the throw. And apparently they practice that kind of throws. Smith had a horror time on the field today; he misfielded, he even dropped a catch but here he is with a direct hit that has won the game for South Africa.

The game was meandering towards nowhere when suddenly Sammy changed it with the innings of his lifetime. He nearly got West Indies home but they ran out of fuel in the end. The boy on the burning deck. He walks ever so slowly out of the park.
Hang on for the quotes from the post-match ceremony.

Gayle: It was a good effort. Credit must go to Sammy for giving us some hope. The middle period was our downfall. too many dot balls. The pressure increases. Game simulation and learn to rotate the strike. We might have a new squad for the third game. Sarwan and Nikita miler will be mostly out. Injuries. I think we can look at the positives from this game and take it to the next one. The middle period we need to work on."

Smith: "Few key chances were missed. Apart from our catching we controlled the game very well. Apart from Sammy's 20 odd balls, we were in control. Sammy played a great knock today. We closed the game down. We did what we had to do. The deck has been slow, we built good partnerships and manipulated the field well, especially in the middle period. We ran hard. Duminy has had a tough time. he has been working on few technical things in the background. I am sure he will get a chance somewhere in this series and he needs to take it."

Amla is the man of the match: "I was quiet fortunate that I played a bit of County cricket before I came here. You always have to develop your game in international cricket ( on working on his off-side field). "
That's it from us. Thanks for joining. Good bye and good luck.

dismissalText.commentary: Ravi Rampaul run out (McLaren) 5 (8b 0x4 0x6 19m) SR: 62.5

commentTextItems.html: Rampaul is run out It was a full pitched delivery and Sammy mistimes the drive to McLaren. Rampaul had backed up too far, trying to get the single that would have given Sammy the strike. McLaren stops the ball, turns and runs to break the stumps. Just one wicket left. What drama here.

commentPostTextItems.html: The injured Nikita Miller comes out. Pollard is the runner. one wicket left. One fit batsman. A runner. What's going to happen here?

commentTextItems.html: Wide surely? yes it is. Full toss well outside off. Sammy has a swing and a miss.
he backs away to punch the length delivery to sweeper cover.

commentPostTextItems.html: Lots of advice coming in from the crowd.

commentPreTextItems.html: Ali: "Sammy's not the prettiest but man does this guy have heart. "

commentTextItems.html: Dot ball. Pressure. Rampaul goes for the big shot to the on side and mistimes the slower one to Smith at short midwicket.
almost yorker length outside off, squeezed out towards sweeper cover. 20 from 15.
length delivery on the pads, pushed to midwicket .. they scramble across for the single. Sammy applauds Rampaul for the single.

commentPreTextItems.html: The two batsmen have a chat. Sammy takes the strike.

commentTextItems.html: full delivery outside off stump, Sammy goes for the big drive and edges it to Amla at square-leg. A single.
and now retains the strike with a drive to long-on. 23 from 18. Drama ... Excitement.. The crowd have gone delirious.

commentTextItems.html: This is absolutely stunning. Gayle stares straight ahead from the dressing room. Sammy is having the time of his life with the bat. He clears the front foot and wallops the full delivery to wide long-on boundary
He has killed this one. Boom! Full delivery on the off and middle line and Sammy smashes it over the bowler;s head. Absolutely crunched!

Lash em Sammy! Oh boy he is making the crowd go mad here. ANother clean swing, another boundary. He backed away, got his front foot to the leg side, opened up his stance and swung to the cow corner. No chance for Kallis this time
Thrash! He gets forward, moves the front foot out of the way and swings it to the cow corner. Kallis gets around from deep midwicket and makes a diving stop near the boundary

commentPostTextItems.html: Grant: "Dont u dare say anything about "FB" rather say Windies dont have a hope in hell!"

commentTextItems.html: full delivery on the middle, pushed out towards long-off and they scramble back for the second run. 40 from 23
kicks up at Rampaul who stabs it to short third man

commentPostTextItems.html: Trevor: "Man, the crowd are better fielders than the Saffers!  First a lady, then a gent, who didn't even spill his rum when catching Sammy's 6's!"

Violence. Massive hit this. The ball has gone to tjhe upper tier in the long-off stands. Lovely fierce swing of the bat. It was the full-length delivery and he just went through the line.
Swing and a miss. It was the full delivery outside off and Sammy tried to whiplash it over point but no wood on leather

dismissalText.commentary: Nikita Miller run out (Smith) 0 (1b 0x4 0x6 1m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: Pollard, the runner is run out Game over. SA have won. Sammy is crestfallen. Smith fires in the direct hit. It was a length delivery on the middle stump line, pushed out to covers.. and they run for the single that would bring Sammy on strike. It was always going to be tight. Smith picks it at short cover, and flicks it back hand and it's direct hit at the non-striker's end with Pollard just short of the crease. Pollard threw in a desperate dive but it was not to be.

dismissalText.commentary: Narsingh Deonarine c Miller b Tsotsobe 7 (17b 0x4 0x6 29m) SR: 41.17

dismissalComment.html: Done in by the slower one! Deonarine had no idea. He leaned forward for the drive and pushed it so tamely to mid-off.

dismissalText.commentary: Dale Richards b Kallis 51 (85b 6x4 0x6 119m) SR: 60

dismissalComment.html: The middle stump has been pegged back. Richards backed away to the leg side for the big hit through off but edged the full delivery to his stumps. He hobbles back to the pavilion.

dismissalText.commentary: Kieron Pollard c Botha b Morkel 29 (35b 1x4 0x6 48m) SR: 82.85

dismissalComment.html: Botha takes a superb catch at long-off. Pollard lofted it towards the deep, Botha ran in and flung himself forward to hang on to a good catch. The ball was dipping rapidly on him but he managed to get his palms under the ball. Windies need 119 from 71 balls.

dismissalText.commentary: Denesh Ramdin run out (Miller) 2 (4b 0x4 0x6 7m) SR: 50

dismissalText.commentary: Dwayne Bravo c Kallis b Steyn 74 (70b 3x4 2x6 114m) SR: 105.71

dismissalComment.html: And SA strike back. Huge wicket this. It was a full length delivery outside off and Bravo threw his hands at it .. The ball flew straight to Kallis at sweeper cover. Surely, game over now?

dismissalText.commentary: Ramnaresh Sarwan c de Villiers b Botha 6 (6b 1x4 0x6) SR: 100

dismissalComment.html: And he is gone first ball! Oh well .. he did try. It was the off break outside off stump, Sarwan tried to late cut it but got a thin edge

dismissalText.commentary: Ravi Rampaul run out (McLaren) 5 (8b 0x4 0x6 19m) SR: 62.5

dismissalComment.html: Rampaul is run out It was a full pitched delivery and Sammy mistimes the drive to McLaren. Rampaul had backed up too far, trying to get the single that would have given Sammy the strike. McLaren stops the ball, turns and runs to break the stumps. Just one wicket left. What drama here.

headshotImage.longCaption: Graeme Smith player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Nikita Miller run out (Smith) 0 (1b 0x4 0x6 1m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: Pollard, the runner is run out Game over. SA have won. Sammy is crestfallen. Smith fires in the direct hit. It was a length delivery on the middle stump line, pushed out to covers.. and they run for the single that would bring Sammy on strike. It was always going to be tight. Smith picks it at short cover, and flicks it back hand and it's direct hit at the non-striker's end with Pollard just short of the crease. Pollard threw in a desperate dive but it was not to be.

stories.title: Ottis Gibson keen on batting coach
stories.subTitle: West Indies v South Africa, 3rd ODI, Dominica
stories.seoTitle: Ottis Gibson keen on batting coach
stories.summary: Following a series of failed run-chases in the home series against South Africa, West Indies head coach Ottis Gibson has identified the role of a batting coach as critical to his team's fortunes

image.caption: Ottis Gibson talks about West Indies' opening match of the World Twenty20
image.longCaption: Ottis Gibson talks about West Indies' opening match of the World Twenty20, April 29, 2010, Georgetown, Guyana

stories.title: South Africa edge home despite Sammy heroics
stories.subTitle: West Indies v South Africa, 2nd ODI, Antigua
stories.seoTitle: South Africa edge home despite Sammy heroics
stories.summary: A stunning late assault from Darren Sammy couldn't prevent South Africa sealing a 17-run victory set-up by fifties from Hashim Amla and Jacques Kallis in a high-scoring game at the Sir Vivian Richards stadium

image.caption: Morne Morkel claimed the crucial wicket of Chris Gayle to give South Africa control
image.longCaption: Morne Morkel claimed the crucial wicket of Chris Gayle to give South Africa control, West Indies v South Africa, 2nd ODI, Antigua, May 24, 2010

stories.title: West Indies seek to bridge the gap
stories.subTitle: West Indies v South Africa, 2nd ODI, Antigua
stories.seoTitle: West Indies seek to bridge the gap
stories.summary: While there is undeniable potential talent in the national squad, and one cannot rule out an improved performance in the second game, it seems more likely that South Africa will maintain the gulf in class between the two sides

image.caption: Hashim Amla is congratulated by AB de Villiers
image.longCaption: Hashim Amla is congratulated by AB de Villiers, West Indies v South Africa, 1st ODI, Antigua, May 22, 2010
